title: Braga (Marcos de)
body: The ancient Madeiran chronicles speak of Marcos de Braga, extolling the feats of courage and bravery he performed, as he was endowed with immense muscular strength, of which he gave great evidence on many occasions, as Gaspar Frutuoso cites various curious examples. This chronicler says that Marcos de Braga "was so hairy that even his nails on the outside, and on his face up to near his eyes were covered with hair...". His son of the same name inherited his father's bravery and also performed some acts of great valor and courage, which Frutuoso did not forget to mention.

Marcos de Braga: Extolled by the ancient Madeiran chronicles, endowed with immense muscular strength
